Class FCTPls

  • java.lang.Object
    • FCTPbas
      • FCTPgreedy
        • FCTPls
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PEheur
    public class FCTPls
extends FCTPgreedy
    Local search methods for the Fixed Charge Transportation Problem (FCTP)

      A (random) multi-start local search method that repeatedly constructs an initial basic feasible solution at random and thereafter applies local search to this initial solution.
      void OsmanSA()
      Applies simulated annealing to the FCTP in a similar way as Osman (1995) did for the generalised assignment problem, that is, by moving through the neighbourhood in an implicitly given order and moving the first accepted neighbouring solution

    • Constructor Detail

      • FCTPls

        public FCTPls​(java.lang.String fname)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        fname - name (that is full path) of the input data file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • FCTPls

        public FCTPls​(int mm,
              int nn,
              int[] s,
              int[] d,
              double[] tc,
              double[] fc,
              boolean copyDat)
        Constructor that takes data as parameters. All data are copied if copyDat=true
        Parameters:
        mm - number of suppliers
        nn - number of customers
        s - integer array of mm supply quantities
        d - integer array of nn demand quantities
        tc - tc[arc] is for arc=i*nn+j the unit transporation cost from supplier i to customer j
        fc - fc[arc] is for arc=i*nn+j the fixed cost on arc from supplier i to customer
        copyDat - true if data should be copied to new arrays. Otherwise just a reference is set to the data.

    • Method Detail

      • getLSiter

        public int getLSiter()
        Return number of iterations performed by one the local search method implemented here

      • LS_best_acc

        public void LS_best_acc()
        Best accept local search (using basic exchanges to create neighbouring solutons)

      • LS_first_acc

        public void LS_first_acc()
        First accept local search (using basic exchanges to create neighbouring solutons)

      • LocalSearch

        public void LocalSearch()
        Performs a local search on the current solution using basic exchanges to create neighbouring solutions. If FCTPparam.ls_type = BEST_ACCEPT, a best accept strategy is followed. If FCTPparam.ls_type = FIRST_ACCEPT, a first accept strategy is followed.

      • Kicksolution

        public void Kicksolution​(int num_exchanges)
        Applies a random kick to the solution stored in the object "solution"
        Parameters:
        num_exchanges - - number of non-basic arcs to be made basic. If equal to zero, this number is randomly decided (between 5 arcs and 20% of the basic arcs)

      • ILS

        public void ILS()
        Iterated local search that uses KickSolution() to generate new (partially) random start solution from a "current" solution. A single iteration either applies a first accept or a best accept local search (actually any other local search method could be used to this end provided it is fast enough.

      • ILS

        public void ILS​(int max_reps)

      • MSLS

        public void MSLS()
        A (random) multi-start local search method that repeatedly constructs an initial basic feasible solution at random and thereafter applies local search to this initial solution. In the first iteration, however, local search to the solution generated before by (deterministic) greedy or the LP heuristic is applied.

      • SA

        public void SA()
        Applies a standard simulated annealing procedure to the FCTP.

      • OsmanSA

        public void OsmanSA()
        Applies simulated annealing to the FCTP in a similar way as Osman (1995) did for the generalised assignment problem, that is, by moving through the neighbourhood in an implicitly given order and moving the first accepted neighbouring solution

      • RandOrder

        protected int[] RandOrder​(int dim)
        Creates a new integer array comprising random integers from 0 to dim-1
        Parameters:
        dim - - dimension of the array
        Returns:
        random permutation of integers 0 ... dim-1

      • RTR_travel

        protected boolean RTR_travel​(double record)
        Application of a a single record to record travel that makes basic exchanges and either applies the first improving one or the best accepted one. Non-basic arcs are scanned by looping over suppliers and customers; best-moves for non-basic arcs adjacent to the current supplier node are searched.
        Parameters:
        record - - best objective function value found so far
        Returns:
        true if a move has been applied; otherwise false

      • RTR_move

        protected void RTR_move​(double record)

      • RTR_proc

        public void RTR_proc()
        Applies a Record-to-Record travel to the FCTP.

      • RTR_Jeanne

        public void RTR_Jeanne()
        RTR travel for the FCTP as suggested in Jeanne Aslak Andersen's take-home exercise in the course on "Metaheuristics", Spring 2010

      • GLS

        public void GLS()
        Guided local search for the FCTP

      • VNS

        public void VNS()
        Variable neighbourhood search for the FCTP

      • Grasp

        public void Grasp()
        GRASP for the FCTP

      • TS

        public void TS()
        Basic tabu search procedure for solving the FCTP
